means: 略提知名人物以示相识而提高自己的身份
高攀高官和名人以抬高身价( name-drop的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: I must stop saying everyone famous is a good friend. It sounds as if I'm name-dropping.
sentence.Network_cn: 我不能再说每位知名人士都是我的好朋友了，听起来像是我在借他们抬高自己。

sentence.Network_en: The assistant carried on talking to his mate, name-dropping all the famous riders he knew.
sentence.Network_cn: 那位助手继续对同伴讲个不停，搬出他认识的所有知名自行车赛手。

sentence.Network_en: One can do a lot of name-dropping with names of the school'sparents. President Nixon sent his daughters there.
sentence.Network_cn: 那所学校的学生家长很多都是名人。尼克松总统就把女儿们送进了那所学校。

entry.tran: 抬出名人显要以提高身价;说出名人名字以抬高自己
entry.def: If you say that someone name-drops, you disapprove of them referring to famous people they have met in order to impress people.

example.ex: The assistant carried on talking to his mate, name-dropping all the famous riders he knew...
example.tran: 那位助手继续对同伴讲个不停，搬出他认识的所有知名自行车赛手。

example.ex: I must stop saying everyone famous is a good friend. It sounds as if I'm name-dropping.
example.tran: 我不能再说每位知名人士都是我的好朋友了，听起来像是我在借他们抬高自己。

means.word_mean: 1. the practice of casually mentioning important people in order to impress your listener;

sentences.sentence: "the hard thing about name-dropping is to avoid being too obvious about it"

auth_sentence.content: But campaigning on the family name is one thing.
auth_sentence.res_content: But campaigning on the family name is one thing.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But campaigning on the family name is one thing.

auth_sentence.content: You can virtually name your team for Rio now.
auth_sentence.res_content: You can virtually name your team for Rio now.

auth_sentence.content: But Miller is most definitely a name to watch.
auth_sentence.res_content: But Miller is most definitely a name to watch.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But Miller is most definitely a name to watch.
